body: This is super unsafe!! The `const char *` data is managed by `v`, so it will be deallocated once the constructor finishes running! We really should capture an `std::string` (possibly a `const std::string`)
body_html: This is super unsafe!! The const char * data is managed by v, so it will be deallocated once the constructor finishes running! We really should capture an std::string (possibly a const std::string)
body_text: This is super unsafe!! The const char * data is managed by v, so it will be deallocated once the constructor finishes running! We really should capture an std::string (possibly a const std::string)
